The event occurred in the context of xenophobic attacks and kidnappings targeting foreign business people.

notes: On 21 November 2022, rioters torched a Golden Arrow and three municipal buses, pelted stones at buses and vehicles, and harassed bus workers in Cape Town - Khayelitsha (City of Cape Town, Western Cape). Unknown suspects opened fire at a bus and injured a passenger and a bus driver. There are reports linking the attacks to the two-day taxi strike, demanding the continuation of the provincial government's Blue Dot program and an end to the impounding of taxis. The South African National Taxi Council (SANTACO) denies that the mob incidents are related to the taxi strike.

assoc_actor_1: Taxi Drivers (South Africa); SANTACO: South Africa National Taxi Council

notes: On 21 November 2022, a mob assaulted a man accused of criminality at Mshongoville Informal Settlement in Atteridgeville (City of Tshwane, Gauteng). The group killed the suspect, damaged the ambulance, and stole medical equipment. Emergency workers sustained injuries from the mob attack.

notes: On 20 November 2022, a mob beat and set alight a pitbull dog in Hennenman (Matjhabeng, Lejweleputswa, Free State) after witnessing two pit bulls attacking and killing an eight-year-old boy. notes: On 2 November 2022, Ethiopian Federal Government signed an agreement with Tigray People's Liberation Front (TPLF), 'for lasting peace through a permanent cessation of hostilities to end the military conflict in northern Ethiopia' in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng). Under the accord, mediated by the African Union, the warring parties have agreed to cease hostilities, restore services, law, and order, and permit unrestricted access to humanitarian supplies. The sides have also agreed to implement a 'smooth disarmament demobilization and rehabilitation (DDR) plan of TPLF fighters' under the deal. The agreement follows recent military gains by ENDF including the capture of the strategic towns of Shire, Axum, and Adwa in Tigray Region in late October.

On 23 February 2022, Free State students blocked (means not specified) the gates of the institution in Bloemfontein (Mangaung, Free State) in a demonstration over a response to a memorandum they handed over to the institution. The police arrested several students for disrupting classes.

On 23 February 2022, about 50 Moeggesukkel, Lapland, Langa and Blikkiesdorp residents gathered at the Kamesh police station in Kariega (Nelson Mandela Bay, Eastern Cape) in a service delivery demonstration. The group handed a petition to the police.

On 23 February 2022, approximately 150 'Khoi settlers' (Khoisan Ethnic Group) set bushes on fire, and pelted stones against police officers around the N2 highway, in the region of the illegal land occupation outside Grabouw (Overberg, Western Cape) over police operations that were taking out some of the land structures. The police responded (means not specified) and one person was injured.

On 22 February 2022, dozens of University of Free State students gathered at the QwaQwa campus in Phuthaditjhaba (Thabo Mofutsanyane, Free State) in a demonstration to demand the payment of their food and book allowances.

assoc_actor_1: NASGB: National Association of School Governing Bodies
notes: On 22 February 2022, about 200 School Governing Body members, affiliated to the NASGB, gathered at the Education Department's OR Tambo Coastal district offices in Mthatha (O.R.Tambo, Eastern Cape) in a demonstration to demand the payment of outstanding wages to school assistants and staff, the fixing of schools damaged by rains and the building of better infrastructure, among other things. The demonstrators were from schools in Libode, Ngqeleni and Port St John.

On 22 February 2022, more than 1,000 Small, Medium and Micro Enterprises (SMMEs) gathered at the Gqeberha City Hall, then marched main roads up to near Summerstrand (Nelson Mandela Bay, Eastern Cape) in a demonstration to demand a share of municipal business tenders.

Around 22 February 2022 (between 20 - 24 February), a pastor from the Spoken Word Fellowship was killed and his body found in a bush in Greytown (Overberg, Western Cape). The pastor went missing three days before his body was found on the 24th; he was stabbed at the back of his neck.

source: Capital Newspaper; Times (South Africa); Daily News (South Africa); Witness; Daily Sun (South Africa)
notes: On 21 February 2022, between 8 to 10 people threw petrol bombs inside a guard house at the Durban University of Technology's Indumiso campus in Pietermaritzburg (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal). Around 18 February 2022 (as reported), parents shut down [means not reported] a primary school in Lethabong (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration over the school's overcrowding.

Around 18 February 2022 (as reported), University of the Free State students gathered in Bloemfontein (Mangaung, Free State) in a demonstration against the mandatory coronavirus vaccination university policy. Three people were arrested

At least two people were armed and opened fire during the chaos that ensued; a vehicle parked outside the Hall was also damaged with stones. The motivation for the event is unknown/not reported; no reports on injuries.
Around 13 February 2022 (as reported), a Somali businessman was shot and killed by unidentified individuals at his shop in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape). Nothing was taken.

The meeting had the goal to elect a leadership for ward 24, and nominate candidates for the next election. 3 people were injured and hospitalized. The motivation for the event is unknown/not reported.

On 17 January 2022, Soweto residents burnt down the stock of street vendors they believed were foreigners at the Bara taxi rank, Johannesburg - Soweto (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng).

On 16 January 2022, a prominent lawyer (and member of the Legal Aid Board) was shot and killed by unidentified individuals in front of his house in the Maniini Block K of Thohoyandou (Vhembe, Limpopo). Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 16 January 2022, family members of a church leader claimed to have been physically assaulted by the police on the N4 highway, presumably in or around Rabokala (Bojanala, North West). The International Pentecost Holiness Church has been facing leadership succession conflicts since 2016.

On 15 January 2022, youth activists gathered at the City Hall in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration against global inequality and to demand the implementation of a wealth tax. The demonstration happened in the context of the virtual World Economic Forum; it was organized by the Fight Inequality Alliance.

assoc_actor_1: AZAPO: Azanian Peoples Organization; PAC: Pan African Congress
notes: On 15 January 2022, AZAPO and PAC members gathered at the Cape Town Magistrate Court (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand the release of the man arrested in connection with the parliament fire. It is believed that the man is being used as a scapegoat.

On 14 January 2022, Renosterberg Municipality employees set tires and other objects on fire in Renosterberg (Pixley ka Seme, Northern Cape) [coded to Petrusville] in a demonstration to demand the payment of late wages.

On 14 January 2022, for a third consecutive day, about 15 people gathered in front of a special school in Johannesburg - Orange Farm (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand that the school be transformed into a mainstream school.

On 14 January 2022, Msunduzi firefighters marched to the Pietermaritzburg City Hall (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to demand answers regarding the payment of their wage arrears, due December 2021.

On 14 January 2022, taxi drivers blocked roads in or around Louis Trichardt (Vhembe, Limpopo) in retaliation against a previous demonstration by community members over taxi fares. The group demanded that buses also increase their fares.

On 14 January 2022, unidentified individuals robbed and vandalized 20 computers from the City's building in Johannesburg - Braamfontein (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in what is believed to be an attempt to stop the city's digitalization plans.

On 13 January 2022, for a second consecutive day, a group gathered in front of a special school in Johannesburg - Orange Farm (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand that the school be transformed into a mainstream school.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (South Africa); SAFTU: South African Federation of Trade Unions; PSA: Palestinian Solidarity Alliance; WASP: Workers and Socialist Party
notes: On 13 January 2022, hundreds of striking employees of a food and beverage company gathered at the in Department of Trade, Industry and Competition in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration regarding late wages, retrenchments and factory closures; the group has been on strike since November 2021. The SAFTU, Palestinian Solidarity Alliance and WASP participated in the demonstration.

On 13 January 2022, about 30 striking employees of a food and beverage company gathered outside the parliament in Cape Town (City of Cape Town; Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand the boycott of products from the company. The strike relates to late wages, retrenchments and factory closures since November 2021.
On 13 January 2022, Klaarwater Mews residents set objects on fire in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration regarding the inconsistent electricity supply in the area.

On 13 January 2022, two zangoma (Zulu healers) were shot and killed by unidentified individuals at the Katilumla Village in Lusikisiki (O.R.Tambo, Eastern Cape). Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 13 January 2022, Siyahlala camp houses were petrol bombed in two occasions on the same day by unidentified individuals in Cape Town - Philippi (City of Cape Town, Western Cape). 8 houses were destroyed. The motivation for the attack is unknown.

source: Daily Sun (South Africa); SABC News; EWN
notes: On 12 January 2022, parents gathered at the N4 highway, near Kroondal (Bojanala, North West) in a demonstration to demand mobile classrooms for their children instead of moving them to a neighboring school after their school was vandalized.

On 12 January 2022, a group gathered in front of a special school in Johannesburg - Orange Farm (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand that the school be transformed into a mainstream school.

On 12 January 2022, a group gathered in front of a food and beverage store in Cape Town - Observatory (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration in support of workers who have been on strike since November 2021 regarding the payment of late wages, retrenchments and factory closures. A group entered the store and started to fill their carts with products, allegedly with no intention of payment, but left peacefully after the management called the police.
On 12 January 2022, parents gathered at Akasia Hoerskool (high school) (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the placement of their children at the school.
Around 12 January 2022 (as reported), community members blocked roads in or around Louis Trichardt (Vhembe, Limpopo) in a demonstration against the price of taxi fares.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (South Africa); ATDF: All Truck Drivers Foundation
assoc_actor_2: Labor Group (International); Police Forces of South Africa (1994-)
notes: On 12 January 2022, about 100 truck drivers, allegedly members of the ATDF, assaulted foreign truck drivers as they blocked the Old Airport road in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal), stopping trucks to demand identification from the drivers. Foreign truck drivers had their keys taken from them and their trucks stoned. The police dispersed the group.

On 11 January 2022, a small crowd gathered at the Cape Town Magistrate Court (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand the release of the man arrested in connection with the parliament fire. It is believed that the man is being used as a scapegoat.
On 11 January 2022, coronavirus health workers gathered in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the renewal of their contracts.

On 11 January 2022, visually-impared workers gathered at the gates of the Centre for the Blind in Ga-Rankuwa (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the payment of their stipends. The group held a night vigil.

On 11 January 2022, two Pakistani shop owners were attacked with bricks, stones, and gun butts by individuals at their shops in Hluvukani (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga) after they refused to pay they group for protection. They were injured and had money stolen.

On 11 January 2022, regiments of amaZulu members demonstrated at the Pietermaritzburg High Court (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) during hearings regarding the group's Royal Household and in support of King Misuzulu as their rightful heir.

Around 11 January 2022 (as reported), employees of a food and beverage company, with support of civil society and trade unions, gathered near the Commission for Conciliation, Mediation, and Arbitration (CCMA) in Cape Town - Zonnebloem (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration regarding late wages, retrenchments and factory closures. The group has been on strike since November 2021.

On 11 January 2022, small, medium and micro enterprises (SMMEs) owners set tires on fire in front of a primary school in Johannesburg - Soweto (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration regarding payment for their services done at the school.

On 10 January 2022, employees of a food and beverage company gathered near the Commission for Conciliation, Mediation, and Arbitration (CCMA) in Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration regarding late wages, retrenchments and factory closures. The group has been on strike since November 2021.

On 10 January 2022, Ngxoki village residents gathered at the Bhityi Periodical Court near Mthatha (O.R.Tambo, Eastern Cape) in a demonstration against the bailing of a man accused of killing his girlfriend.
On 10 January 2022, parents gathered at Akasia Hoerskool (high school) (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the placement of their children at the school.

source: Daily Sun (South Africa); Cape Argus; EWN; GroundUp
notes: On 9 January 2022, a homeless man was shot in his face and killed by a police officer in Cape Town - Rondebosch (City of Cape Town, Western Cape). The officer was answering a complaint regarding the homeless individuals cooking a meal outdoors when a discussion ensued. The police officer was arrested and later released.

On 9 January 2022, a woman was sexually assaulted by a police officer in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) as the women tried to open a case of assault at the Brackenville police station. The officer assaulted the woman after telling her that he would take her to a safe place. The woman was hospitalized.

On 8 January 2022, MKMVA members gathered outside the Old Peter Mokaba Stadium in Polokwane (Capricorn, Limpopo) in a demonstration against the ANC NEC, which, they stated, did not attend to their demands over the years.

On 8 January 2022, the car of a food and beverage company employee was petrol bombed by unidentified individuals in Clayville (Ekurhuleni, Gauteng). It is believed that the attack was meant to pressure the employees, on strike since November 2021, to end the strike regarding wages, retrenchments and factory closures.

On 7 January 2022, a group gathered at the Piketberg Magistrate's Court (West Coast, Western Cape) in a demonstration against the granting of bail for a police officer accused of killing his girlfriend.

On 7 January 2022, a group gathered in front of the Kimberley Magistrate's Court (Frances Baard, Northern Cape) in a demonstration to demand bail for a group accused of killing two individuals who allegedly broke into a house in Roodepan.

On 7 January 2022, the house of a Mozambican family was set on fire by a mob in Dwarsloop (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga). The group was looking for one of the family members, whom them accuse of being involved in the robbery and killing of a man on 1 January and sexual assault. No one was injured.

On 7 January 2022, the car of a food and beverage company employee was petrol bombed by unidentified individuals in Johannesburg - City Deep (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng). It is believed that the attack was meant to pressure the company's employees, on strike since November 2021, to end the strike regarding wages, retrenchments and factory closures.
On 6 January 2022, a group used tree branches to block the N4 highway, in the center of Dinokana (Ngaka Modiri Molema, North West), in a demonstration regarding lack of water in the region.
On 6 January 2022, a group stoned cars along the R554 and R82 roadways near Johannesburg - Eikenhof (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) during a demonstration against the demolishing of their houses.

On 6 January 2022, a group (assumed with affiliation to ANC) gathered at the Ntuzuma magistrate's court (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against bail for the suspects in killing three women during an ANC meeting in Inanda.

On 5 January 2022, Jackson Farm settlement residents set tires on fire and blocked the R82 road with rocks and rubble in Johannesburg - Eikenhof (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a service delivery demonstration.
On 5 January 2022, a man was beaten and injured by a mob at the Stock informal settlement in Komga (Amathole, Eastern Cape) under accusations of stealing a laptop. Five people were arrested.

On 4 January 2022, about 150 members of the Rastafarian community took to the streets in Gqeberha (Nelson Mandela Bay, Eastern cape) in a demonstration to demand better cannabis laws. The demonstration was led by the Nelson Mandela Bay Rastafari Ganja Council (RGC).

On 4 January 2022, a group gathered at the Piketberg Magistrate's Court (West Coast, Western Cape) in a demonstration against the granting of bail for a police officer accused of killing his girlfriend.

On 4 January 2022, Umbumbulu Coastal Tvet College security guards set tires and trees on fire at the institution's entrance in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration regarding the late payment of wages.

On 3 January 2022, two individuals were killed in what is believed to be a mob justice event at the Jerusalem settlement, Roodepan (Frances Baard, Northern Cape). The two were attacked after the community was unable to verify if they were related to the owner of the house they were in.

On 3 January 2022, family and friends of three women killed during an ANC meeting in Inanda gathered at the Ntuzuma magistrate's court (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against bail for the suspects. Some demonstrators were wearing ANC regalia.

On 3 January 2022, a man was attacked with sjamboks and killed by a mob of nine people in Kgoptjane, around Tseki (Thabo Mofutsanyane, Free State) under accusations of stealing their belongings. The nine were arrested.

source: EWN; Daily Sun (South Africa); News24 (South Africa); George Herald (South Africa); City Press (South Africa); GardaWorld; Citizen (South Africa); Cape Argus; Times (South Africa)
notes: Property destruction: On 2 January 2022, the parliament of Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) was set on fire. One person was arrested in connection to the event. The Old Assembly and National Assembly were considerably damaged in the fire which lasted for 2-3 days.

Around 30 December 2021, two teenagers were shot and injured by a group of individuals in Umlazi (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). The group, which included a KwaZulu-Natal councilor, were attacking and assaulting family members of a newly elected ward councilor in the Mid Illovo area demanding to know his whereabouts. Three of the four suspects were arrested.

Around 30 December 2021, three people were killed and seven were wounded by a group of individuals in either Sydenham or Camperdown (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal). The group, which included a KwaZulu-Natal councilor, were attacking and assaulting family members of a newly elected ward councilor in the Mid Illovo area demanding to know his whereabouts. Three of the four suspects were arrested.

On 30 December 2021, a man was killed by a group of five people at the at Majuba Lane, Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) under accusations of stealing speakers of one of them. Three individuals were arrested.

On 28 December 2021, two individuals were assaulted with various objects and killed by a mob at the Tsepong new developing area, De Deur (Sedibeng, Gauteng) moments after a foreign shop owner was stabbed by one of them during a robbery at his store.

On 28 December 2021, a man was assaulted, injured, tied up with a chain by a group of five people at Flower Road, Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) after the man was caught removing wires from the group's vehicle. Three individuals were arrested and the other two fled.

On 26 December 2021, two individuals were assaulted by a mob in a bar in Phola (Nkangala, Mpumalanga) after one of them shot and injured another man from whom they wanted to recover a mobile phone. One of the assaulted individuals later died.

On 26 December 2021, a man was beaten, burnt with a hot iron and locked up inside a bar by a group of family members in or around KwaMashu (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) under accusations of stealing a mobile phone. The man was injured and released on the following day after the group found the phone with another person.
On 26 December 2021, a man was killed by a mob in or around Bloemfontein (Mangaung, Free State) under accusations of trying to steal livestock.

source: IOL; Citizen (South Africa); Times (South Africa); News24 (South Africa)
notes: On 26 December 2021, a man was beaten to death and set on fire by a mob in Trenance Park, near Verulam (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) under accusations of killing his seven-year-old stepson after he set his house on fire with the child inside it.
On 23 December 2021, Zone 13 and 24 community members marched to the Eskom office in Sebokeng (Sedibeng, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the restoration of their electricity.

On 23 December 2021, Nkululeko informal settlement residents set tires on fire, closed roads and threw stones at vehicles in Northdale (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration regarding lack of electricity. The group tried to storm a substation and attacked with pangas and threw stones at a police officer guarding the area; the substation was set on fire. The police officer was injured.

On 22 December 2021, just over 10 students assaulted private security officers at an off-campus post-graduate residence in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) while resisting their eviction. The university claimed that relocations were part of coronavirus-related measures. Several people were injured; a private security guard was hospitalized after hot water was thrown at him.
On 22 December 2021, Northdale residents blocked the Dr Chota Motala Road in Pietermaritzburg (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against the lack of electricity in the region.

On 21 December 2021, Steve Tshwete Local Municipality residents gathered at the Optimum Coal Mine in Middelburg (Nkangala, Mpumalanga) in a demonstration against the seizure of the mine's assets by the National Prosecuting Authority (NPA).
On 21 December 2021, an Ethiopian shop owner died in Pietermaritzburg (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) after unidentified armed individuals robbed his store and set it on fire.

On 21 December 2021, a group set a house on fire in Praktiseer (Sekhukhune, Limpopo) after a man sexually assaulted and killed a boy. The man was arrested, but the group set his family house on fire, forcing them to flee. No one was injured.

assoc_actor_1: Lawyers (South Africa); Government of South Africa (1994-)
notes: On 20 December 2021, a group of prosecutors gathered outside the Pietermaritzburg Magistrate's Court (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration regarding security matters of their careers after a prosecutor was killed the previous week.

assoc_actor_1: KAA: Koeberg Alert Alliance; SAFCEI: Southern African Faith Communities Environment Initiative
notes: On 17 December 2021, KAA and SAFCEI supporters gathered at the Bloubergstrand Beach, Cape Town - Blouberg (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration against a nuclear power plant operation extension in the area.

Weapons seizure: On 17 December 2021, the police seized a large number of 'Viper booster' explosives inside a house in Mooi River (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal). The explosives were to be used following a High Court ruling regarding the return of former president Jacob Zuma to prison.
On 17 December 2021, Nellmapius residents took to the streets in Waltloo (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the restoration of their electricity supply.
On 17 December 2021, farm workers gathered at four farms in the Augrabies area near Kakamas (Z F Mgcawu, Northern Cape) in a demonstration against their current living conditions.

assoc_actor_1: ACDP: African Christian Democratic Party; Christian Group (South Africa)
notes: On 17 December 2021, about 150 ACDP supporters held a motorcade from Tsakane in Ekurhuleni to the Union Buildings in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration against mandatory coronavirus vaccinations.

On 16 December 2021, eBhekuzulu, Kwatas, eMadoshini and the Sasko community members, led by the Nkosibagcine Orphans (HIV/AIDS) organization, took to the streets in Vryheid (Zululand, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against gender-based violence (GBV).

On 15 December 2021, eSwatini nationals living in South Africa gathered outside the Department of International Relations and Co-operation in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in solidarity with the people of eSwatini and to demand democratic reforms in the country. Members of the Swaziland Solidarity Network participated in the event.
On 15 December 2021, a group, led by the ANC, gathered at the eSwatini embassy in Johannesburg - Braamfontein (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) to demand pro-democracy reforms in the country.
On 15 December 2021, a group gathered outside the Musina Magistrate's Court, Musina (Vhembe, Limpopo) in a demonstration regarding the high level of crimes in the area.

On 14 December 2021, Buffalo City Metro coastal protection unit gathered at the City Hall in East London (Buffalo City, Eastern Cape) in a demonstration against late wages. The police fired tear gas against the group.

On 14 December 2021, Middleburg, Hendrina and Witbank community members gathered at the NPA offices in Silverton (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to request the NPA to cancel its application to seize the Optimum Mine, which would negatively impact families in the area.

On 10 November 2021, a traditional leader of the Zondi Traditional Council was shot and killed by unidentified individuals in the Mpotholo area, in or around Nkandla (Uthungulu, KwaZulu-Natal). Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 10 November 2021, a group gathered in front of the Townhill police station in Pietermaritzburg (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to demand answer in the case of a woman found dead on 31 October.
Looting: On 10 November 2021, a family of four were tied up by unidentified armed individuals and had their farm ransacked on the D96 road, around Newcastle (Amajuba, KwaZulu-Natal).

source: GroundUp; Daily Sun (South Africa); Mail & Guardian (South Africa)
notes: On 9 November 2021, about 100 people took to the streets of Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand a patent law reform to make coronavirus and other disease treatments more accessible. The march was organized by the Fix the Patent Laws campaign.

On 9 November 2021, hundreds of individuals gathered in front of the Parliament in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand the implementation of the Climate Justice Charter.

On 9 November 2021, a woman was attacked with pangas and injured by unidentified individuals at her farmhouse in Middelrus, between Mooi River and Greytown (Umzinyathi, KwaZulu-Natal). Motivation for attack unknown.

On 8 November 2021, a man was assaulted and severely injured and held at gunpoint with his family by five unidentified armed individuals at his farm outside Estcourt (Uthukela, KwaZulu-Nata). The group ransacked the farm.

source: South Coast Sun; Sowetan (South Africa); Citizen (South Africa); Witness; Daily Sun (South Africa)
notes: On 8 November 2021, scores of individuals set tires on fire, barricading roads in Isipingo (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration over the municipal elections results and over the fact that some were unable to vote.

On 8 November 2021, Ward 13 residents barricades roads with tires and rubble on fire in Pietermaritzburg (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against the councilor appointed for their ward.

On 8 November 2021, students set tires on fire, barricading the entrance of the Sefako Makgatho University in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand to stay at university's residences despite the end of their contract.
On 8 November 2021, a group closed the Golden Highway in Johannesburg - Orange Farm (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a service delivery demonstration.

assoc_actor_1: Students (South Africa); EFFSC: Economic Freedom Fighters Students Command
notes: On 8 November 2021, Durban University students set university's property on fire on the Steve Biko, Ritson and ML Sultan campuses in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) over lack of response by the university regarding several issues, including the payment of late allowances and learning devices. The demonstration was led by the Student EFF.

On 6 November 2021, dozens of individuals gathered in front of the Parliament in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand governmental action regarding the environmental crisis.
On 6 November 2021, a man was killed by a mob at Dumphries B, near Bushbuckridge (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga). The man was the leader of a group that robbed houses and stole cattle.

Around 6 November 2021 (as reported), an eSwatini truck driver was killed by unidentified individuals and his body was found tied up inside his truck in Standerton (Gert Sibande, Mpumalanga). The truck driver was an employee in a company of a eSwatini MP. Nothing was taken.

On 6 November 2021, more than 300 ANC members marched to the party's offices in Pietermaritzburg (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to demand a halt in the interview process for mayoral candidates for the Moses Mabhida region until the conclusion of the candidates list for councilor.

On 6 November 2021, a mob attacked a Nigerian national in Johannesburg - Alexandra (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) after he shot a South African national. The police intervened to rescue the man from the group.

On 5 November 2021, Mamelodi Local and Long-distance Taxi Association taxi drivers marched to a police station in Silverton (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration against violence against taxi drivers. The group handed a memorandum at the police station.

On 5 November 2021, three armed individuals clashed with police officers as the group tried to enter a council office in KwaMashu (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). During the shoot-out, one of the armed individuals was shot and killed and a police officer was shot and injured. The other 2 perpetrators fled with a police officer's gun.
On 5 November 2021, hundreds of individuals took to the streets in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to bring awareness to the impact of climate change on marginalized communities.

assoc_actor_1: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; Independent Politicians (South Africa)
notes: Around 4 November 2021 (as reported), EFF members and independent candidates for Ward 114 Mfuleni marched to the IEC offices in Cape Town - Khayelitsha (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration regarding, what they stated, are discrepancies in the voting process in the ward during the municipal elections.
On 4 November 2021, two men were beaten and injured by a mob in Johannesburg - Eldorado Park (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) after the two, along with four others who fled, robbed a supermarket.

On 4 November 2021, students from the Sefako Makgatho Health Sciences campus burnt tires in front of the institution in Ga-Rankuwa (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration against the fact that the students' resident management failed to consult them for next year's renewal of contracts.

On 4 November 2021, students' representatives from various universities gathered at the University of South Africa Sunnyside campus (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the dismissal of a student council member accused of sexual harassment.

On 4 November 2021, about 400 members of seven Unemployment Community Forums gathered outside a soft drink factory at the Frikkie Meyer Boulevard in Vanderbijlpark (Sedibeng, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand jobs.

On 4 November 2021, nearly 50 staff of the KwaZulu-Natal Gambling Board set tires and tree trunks on fire, closing the George Macfarlane road in Pietermaritzburg (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to demand the payment of late bonuses and salary increases.

On 4 November 2021, a cattle herder was shot and killed and other two were shot and injured by three armed individuals while herding cattle in the Serutube village (Bojanala, North West). The group robbed their belongings and stole at least 11 animals that were later recovered. 2 people were arrested.

source: Daily Sun (South Africa); IOL; Times (South Africa); News24 (South Africa)
notes: On 4 November 2021, about 300 Dalton Hostel community members set tires on fire along the Sydney road in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration regarding their inability to cast votes during the municipal elections. The group also set a vehicle and guard house on fire and damaged the windows of an administrative block of the Ethekwini College.
On 3 November 2021, TCM supporters blocked (non specified) a road in Kroondal (Bojanala, North West) in a demonstration, claiming the municipal elections were not free and fair.
On 2 November 2021, a man was beaten to death by a mob in Godidi (Amathole, Eastern Cape) under accusations of stealing sheep.

Around 2 November 2021 (as reported), a man accused of killing a senior finance official of the Gauteng Department of Health was tortured by police officers while arrested in Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng). The man claims he was tortured into confessing the involvement in the killing.

On 2 November 2021, a group of artists gathered outside the Sport, Arts and Culture Minister's offices in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) after a scheduled meeting with the minister was cancelled last minute. The group was pushed around by the police and one of the female artists had her blouse ripped off by the officers. The group has several demands, including the dismissal of the Minister, who, as they stated, lacks understanding of the industry.
On 1 November 2021, Emaphupheni community members set tires on fire and barricaded the R555 highway towards old Delmas road near Daveyton (Ekurhuleni, Gauteng) in a service delivery demonstration.

On 1 November 2021, police clashed with armed individuals at a voting station in the Azalea settlement, Plessislaer (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) as the municipal elections were taking place. The group was in a car and opened fire when the police approached; they retaliated and 3 of the armed individuals were killed.

On 1 November 2021, a journalist was assaulted by a group wearing ANC t-shirts at the Talana Hostel in Tzaneen (Mopani, Limpopo). The journalist was covering the municipal elections and was ordered to leave the premise.

On 1 November 2021, Zanelizwe villagers set ANC t-shirts on fire in front of a voting station in KwaNikhwe, Mbizana municipality (Alfred Nzo, Eastern Cape) [coded to Bizana] in a service delivery demonstration and as the municipal elections were taking place.

On 1 November 2021, a man was beaten to death and set on fire by a mob in the Edinburgh village, outside Thulamahashe / Thulamahashi (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga). According to the residents, the man was terrorizing the village and killed 5 people the week prior.

On 1 November 2021, an IFP candidate for the municipal elections and party agents were attacked twice by ANC supporters in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) as the municipal elections were taking place. The candidate had his vehicle attacked, causing broken windows, at Entukusweni Hall and then at Ximba Hall.

On 1 November 2021, a group took to the streets in Umdloti (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in demonstration during the municipal elections. Reason for demonstration not reported/unknown. Voting was delayed at some stations due to the demonstration.

On 1 November 2021, a group took to the streets in Camperdown (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) in demonstration during the municipal elections. The exact motivation for the demonstration was unknown/not reported.
Around 1 November 2021 (as reported), a group took to the streets in Waterdal (Sedibeng, Gauteng) in a demonstration against coal pollution.
Around 1 November 2021 (as reported), demonstrators dug trenches to prevent access to voting stations in Umzinto (Ugu, KwaZulu-Natal) ahead of the 1 November municipal elections.

On 1 November 2021, a man (mentiond to be a 'suspect') was killed by a vigilante mob in Swaneville, in or around Kagiso (West Rand, Gauteng). Motivation for the event is unknown/not reported. 2 people were arrested.

On 1 November 2021, a group stole a ballot box filled with completed ballot papers in Ward 12 of Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) as the municipal elections were taking place. The group took the box after they found out that their names were not on the voter's roll, although they had registered. The police retrieved the box.

On 1 November 2021, a group set a classroom on fire used as the Ntobeko voting station, in ward 2 of Mkhambathini municipality (Umgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) [coded to Camperdown] allegedly following a dispute regarding the area's chief.

On 31 October 2021, NFP secretary-general was assaulted and injured by a group (likely by IFP supporters) in the Nsukazi area in Ulundi (Zululand, KwaZulu-Natal) for wearing a party's t-shirt in the area that is dominated by the Inkatha Freedom Party. The man was hospitalized.
On 31 October 2021, a man was killed by a mob in Cape Town - Nyanga (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) under accusations of raping his niece.

Around 31 October 2021 (between 31 October - 1 November), demonstrators dug trenches around voting centers in the Matatiele municipality (Alfred Nzo, Eastern Cape) ahead of the 1 November municipal elections.

Around 31 October 2021 (between 31 - 1 November), demonstrators calling for improved service delivery dug trenches around voting centers in the Ntabankulu municipality (Alfred Nzo, Eastern Cape) ahead of the 1 November municipal elections.
Around 31 October 2021, a Somali national was shot and killed by unidentified individuals in Cape Town - Mitchells Plain (City of Cape Town, Western Cape). Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 31 October 2021, a group set IEC (Electoral Commission of South Africa) material on fire at a voting station in the Nkundla Junior Secondary School, Bizana (Alfred Nzo, Eastern Cape) ahead of the 1 November municipal elections.
On 31 October 2021, a group broke into a voting station in Fraser's camp (Sarah Baartman, Eastern Cape) and stole a map and a voter management device ahead of the 1 November municipal elections.

On 30 October 2021, a group took to the streets in Mamelodi (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to raise awareness against the use of tobacco.

On 30 October 2021, a group pelted stones against police officers and barricaded roads with burning tires, ruble and branches in Umzinto (Ugu, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against the current area councilor and the lack of service delivery. The police shot live ammunition to disperse the group; 3 people (including one police officer) were shot and injured and at least 8 officers were injured by the stone throwing.

The demonstration happened as the President, and member of the ANC, was in the area for local elections campaign.

On 29 October 2021, three armed individuals clashed with a police officer after the group invaded a councilor's office in KwaMashu (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). The officer was shot and injured and one of the armed individuals was shot and killed. The two others fled, stealing a gun.

On 28 October 2021, teachers from a primary school in Protea Glen marched to the Gauteng Department of Education in Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand better school conditions, including more classrooms and money for toilet paper.
On 28 October 2021, a group gathered in front of the DA offices in Sunnyside (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration against the party, which they accuse of being racist.

On 28 October 2021, 3 farm workers were shot and killed by unidentified individuals at the Balmacara farm, near Van Stadensrus (Mangaung, Free State) near the Lesotho border. Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 27 October 2021, an independent candidate for the local elections was stabbed and injured by a man inside his house in Polokwane (Capricorn, Limpopo). Although electronics were taken, it is reportedly not clear whether the event was a robbery or a politically motivated attack.

assoc_actor_1: Not In My Name South Africa

On 27 October 2021, a group sets tires on fire and barricaded roads with trees and rocks in Johannesburg - Diepkloof (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration against the lack of electricity in the area.

Similar demonstrations were registered in other locations in the country (coded separately). The police arrested 8 truck drivers

On 26 October 2021, truck drivers blocked with their trucks the N3 highway in Bergville (Uthukela, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against foreign truck drivers. Similar demonstrations were registered in other locations in the country (coded separately).

On 26 October 2021, a man was burnt to death after a mob set his house on fire at the Lusaka informal settlement, Chatsworth (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). The mob acted for being 'tired of crime in the area' and decided to burn the house where two suspects lived.

assoc_actor_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union; Labor Group (South Africa)

On 25 October 2021, truck drivers blocked with their trucks the N10 highway outside Middelburg (Chris Hani, Eastern Cape), for a second day, in a demonstration against foreign truck drivers. Similar demonstrations were registered in other locations in the country (coded separately).

Around 25 October 2021 (as reported), a group gathered outside the Phoenix Police Station (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration regarding the death of a man, arrested during the July arrests, under police custody.

On 25 October 2021, KaNyamazane, Pienaar, Lehawu, Tekwane South, Matsulu and Emoyeni residents set tires on fire in several Nelspruit areas (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga) in a service delivery demonstration.

On 24 October 2021, truck drivers blocked with their trucks the N10 highway outside Middelburg (Chris Hani, Eastern Cape) in a demonstration against foreign truck drivers. Similar demonstrations were registered in other locations in the country (coded separately).

According to the residents, six people were in the van from where the shots came from, four of them wearing police uniforms.

The group also accused the regional leaders of selling plots, contributing to overcrowding. A demonstration was also registered on the next day (coded separately). No reports on injuries.

source: Daily Sun (South Africa); Daily Dispatch; Witness; GardaWorld; Mercury (South Africa); Citizen (South Africa); EWN; Sowetan (South Africa); News24 (South Africa); IOL
notes: On 25 January 2021, MKMVA members took to the streets in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) to hand over a memorandum in the city hall regarding soldier's conditions, the ANC leadership, and coronavirus-related measures. During the march, a group looted and set on fire the shops of foreign individuals. The MKMVA denied involvement with the lootings. According to the police, the march was illegal. No reports on injuries. 1 person was arrested after he tried to stab a police officer attending the attacks.

On 24 January 2021, more than 100 villagers stormed the Tyefu police station and locked 6 police officers inside the unit in Peddie (Amathole, Eastern Cape) in an action against what they stated are unreliable police officers. The police unit and flag pole were damaged. 4 people were arrested.

On 24 January 2021, a group took to the streets in Sebokeng (Sedibeng, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the removal of officers from the police station, who they called 'lazy' in dealing with sexual abuse cases.

On 22 January 2021, at least 100 pastors marched until the Union Buildings in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the opening of churches during the coronavirus pandemic, claiming that people need the support of churches. The group handed over a memorandum to the presidency office.

Around 22 January 2021 (as reported), a man was stoned, whipped with a sjambok and killed by a mob in the Elite region, Phuthaditjhaba (Thabo Mofutsanyana, Free State). The man was believed to have broken into a house in the Dithotaneng village, QwaQwa.

Around 22 January 2021 (as reported), a man was beaten and killed by a mob in Chatsworth (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) for allegedly stealing. 3 people were arrested in February 2021 in connection to the event.

On 20 January 2021, workers of a broadcast company blocked the M1 North, near Samrand road in Centurion (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration against workers' retrenchments. A motorcade followed until the Unions Buildings to hand a memorandum to the government.

Around 20 January 2021 (as reported), a female warrant police officer and a man were shot and killed, and their bodies found in the Bhukuveni village, near Flagstaff (OR Tambo, Eastern Cape). The woman's body was found hanged in the roof of a house, with her hands tied behind her back, while the man's body was found inside the officer's vehicle, abandoned in a nearby field. The relationship between the two deaths is being investigated. Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 20 January 2021, about 50 residents entered a construction site and disrupted the installation of tanks and electricity in the Area 11, Uitenhage (Nelson Mandela Bay, Eastern Cape). The construction would benefit elderly, disabled and blind citizens during the coronavirus, and the residents invaded the location after not being told that there would be workers in the area, claiming that all activities must be authorized by them due to corruption possibilities.

On 19 January 2021, dozens of workers of a broadcast company drove from Auckland Park in Johannesburg to the Union Buildings in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration against the planned retrenchment of about 300 employees.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (South Africa); NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
notes: Around 19 January 2021 (as reported), workers of an auto company, supported by NUMSA, gathered in front of its offices in Rosslyn (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration against a cut in their bonus payment. The group was on strike from 15 January to 19 January.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (South Africa); NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa
notes: On 18 January 2021, NUMSA workers gathered in front of the offices of a steel company in Cape Town - Bellville (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand the reinstatement of 99 retrenched employees during the coronavirus pandemic.

Around 18 January 2021 (week of), about 60 security guards demonstrated outside the Tshwane University of Technology's Soshanguve South campus (City of Tshwane, Gauteng), to demand the payment of late wages. Tires were burnt at the entrance.

Around 18 January 2021 (between 18 - 19 January), 4 Somali nationals were injured (including with firearms) and at least 6 Somali-owned shops were hit during attacks by unidentified individuals in Atteridgeville (City of Tshwane, Gauteng).

On 17 January 2021, a former chief of the Manyavu traditional council of the uMgungundlovu district was shot and killed inside his house near Cato Ridge, outside Pietermaritzburg (uMgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal). Motivation and authorship are unknown.

On 15 January 2021, unemployed youth blocked a road in Kabokweni (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga) in a demonstration to demand the removal of officials from the Safety and Security Department. The group also called for a fair recruitment process of candidates for the nursing college.

On 15 January 2021, a professional counsellor was beaten and injured by 3 police officers at a clinic in Johannesburg - Soweto (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) after she tried to leave an abused baby under the police protection to be handed to social workers.

source: EWN; JBay News; African News Agency
notes: On 15 January 2021, over 100 people attacked police officers with stones as they were arresting 2 individuals in the Louterwater area, near Joubertina (Cacadu, Eastern Cape). The 2 individuals were disobeying regulations on liquor sales related to coronavirus measures. No one was injured. 9 people were arrested.

On 15 January 2021, unidentified individuals opened fire on 2 trucks and their drivers in the Swartkoppies bridge region, Brackenhurst (Ekurhuleni, Gauteng). After the drivers fled, the trucks were set on fire. One vehicle was empty and the other was carrying empty bottles. No one was injured.

Around 15 January 2021 (month of), a man and a woman were beaten, injured and denied medical treatment by police officers after being arrested allegedly under false accusations in Cape Town - Delft (City of Cape Town, Western Cape).
On 15 January 2021, a former chief of the Nxamalala sub-clan and iduna was shot 12 times and killed inside his house near Howick (uMgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal). Motivation and authorship are unknown.

source: Daily Sun (South Africa); News24 (South Africa); Times (South Africa); Citizen (South Africa)
notes: On 14 January 2021, a group attending an 'after tears' gathering assaulted police officers as they tried to confiscate alcohol and disperse the between 150 to 200 group in Protea Glen (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng). One police officer was injured; 2 people were arrested. Gatherings have been prohibited within coronavirus-related measures.

On 14 January 2021, activists and residents took to the streets in Midrand (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration against gender-based violence (GBV). The group handed a memorandum to the Midrand police station.

On 14 January 2021, Rondevlei informal settlement residents where shot near Cape Town - Lavender Hill (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) during an eviction operation. The private officers, the Red Ants, were working under the municipal government for the eviction of families in the area. At least 1 woman was injured.

On 14 January 2021, a demonstration was registered on the Greytown-Dundee road (uMzinyathi, KwaZulu-Natal). The motivation for the demonstration was unknown, but it was believed to be over service delivery.

Around 13 January 2021 (as reported), family and friends of a woman killed around Christmas gathered in front of the Vereeniging Magistrate Court, Vereeniging (Sedibeng, Gauteng) in a demonstration, demanding the accused to be denied bail.

source: Times (South Africa); Citizen (South Africa); News24 (South Africa)
notes: On 12 January 2021, a ANC member, and one of the main supporters of a former Durban mayor, was shot and killed by 2 armed individuals inside his house in Verulam (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). According to authorities, it is unclear whether the crime was politically motivated.

On 12 January 2021, the house of a rape suspect was destroyed by a mob in Gugulethu (City of Cape Town, Western Cape). The man was arrested after girls accused him of sexually assaulting them on 9 January 2021. The mob also chased the man's wife and child away.

On 11 January 2021, a group gathered in front of a broadcasting company in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to demand the use of Ivermectin for the treatment of the coronavirus. The demonstration was organized by the ADeC.

On 10 January 2021, a mob set the house of a family on fire in the Welverdiend village outside Thulamahashe/Thulamahashi (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga), accusing one of the family members of killing another person with witchcraft. It was not reported whether the family was in the house or if they were injured.

source: Times (South Africa); News24 (South Africa); Sedibeng Star; EWN; Daily Sun (South Africa); Citizen (South Africa)
notes: On 9 January 2021, the police fired rubber bullets and stun grenades at a crowd of about 250 people who started to throw chairs at them as the officers tried to disperse the group during a mass in Sebokeng (Sedibeng, Gauteng) for disobeying coronavirus-related measures. At least one women was injured; she was arrested and later released. 3 other people were also arrested. The group stated that they had permission for the church gathering.

source: Citizen (South Africa); Sowetan (South Africa); Daily Sun (South Africa)
notes: On 9 January 2021, a prince from the Ndzundza Mabhoko tribal authority was shot and killed while in his car in Siyabuswa (Nkangala, Mpumalanga). Motivation and authorship are unknown.

source: IOL; Sowetan (South Africa); Daily Sun (South Africa); Times (South Africa); Daily Dispatch; Citizen (South Africa); News24 (South Africa)
notes: On 9 January 2021, a mob fatally attacked a women accused of witchcraft, locked her inside a house, setting it on fire in Mbuzini (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga). The woman's family claim she was a traditional leader. 5 people were arrested.
tags: crowd size=no report; women targeted: accused of witchcraft/sorcery

notes: On 7 January 2021, Mabena clan members gathered in front of a news agency office in Auckland Park (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the removal of ads referring to 'dumb' people as Mabenas.

Around 7 January 2021 (as reported), Phophola residents burnt down the hut of a traditional healer in Stinkwater in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng). The group believe that the healer was involved in the death of a women in December 2020 through witchcraft. The group also burnt the house belonging to the woman's boyfriend; and threatened his whole family.

On 6 January 2021, a group of young people gathered in front of the police unit of Langa (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration against the fact that the unit does not open sexual assault cases.

On 6 January 2021, a man was attacked and injured by a mob after he, and 2 other armed men, shot and killed one individual and injured another in the Canelands region, Verulam (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). The 2 other individuals evaded. The man caught by the mob was arrested.

On 6 January 2021, a man was attacked by a mob after he and 2 other people shot and killed a person and injured another in the Canelands community in Verulam (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). The other suspects fled. The man was arrested.

On 5 January 2021, a group blocked the road between Carletonville and Welverdiend (West Rand, Gauteng) in a demonstration against the lack of electricity in the region. The group also held a demonstration on the previous day (coded separately).

Property destruction: Around 5 January 2021 (between 5 - 6 January), 3 telecommunications network infrastructure towers were burnt and destroyed in uMlazi, KwaMashu and Ntuzuma, in the city of Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). The authorship and motivation for the attacks were unknown, but it is believed that the towers might have been destroyed after false information regarding 5G and coronavirus were spread on social media.

On 5 January 2021, ward 25 residents gathered in front of a Retief primary substation in Pietermaritzburg (uMgungundlovu, KwaZulu-Natal) to demand answers regarding when electricity would be restored in the region. The area has been without electricity since 30 December 2020.

On 4 January 2021, a group blocked the road between Carletonville and Welverdiend (West Rand, Gauteng) in a demonstration against the lack of electricity in the region. The group was requesting money to let drivers pass through. The group also held a demonstration on the following day (coded separately).

On 4 January 2021, a man was beaten and injured by a mob in Mamelodi (City of Tshwane, Gauteng). The man allegedly raped a girl on 26 December 2020. After being caught, he pretended to be dead to survive, being rescued by the police.

assoc_actor_1: ANCYL: African National Congress Youth League
assoc_actor_2: ANCWL: African National Congress Womens League; Women (South Africa)
source: News24 (South Africa); Sowetan (South Africa); Times (South Africa); IOL
notes: On 4 January 2021, members of the ANCYL and ANCWL gathered in front of the Wynberg magistrate's court (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) during the hearing of a councilor from the city of Johannesburg, a member of the ANC, arrested under sexual assault accusations. While members of the ANCYL were there supporting the man, members of the ANCWL were supporting the victim. The man was released on the same day and voluntarily stepped down from his duties.

source: Times (South Africa); Sowetan (South Africa); Daily Dispatch
notes: On 4 January 2021, a group gathered in front of the Mamelodi magistrate court, Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) to demand the justice not to grant bail to a man arrested for allegedly stabbing a girl to death on 29 December 2020 after the girl's mother refused to listen to a message 'from God' the man had for her.

On 3 January 2021, 2 men were locked inside a car that was set on fire by a mob in Mputi in Mthatha/Umtata (OR Tambo, Eastern Cape). The 2 were passing through the location when they were accused by a resident of stealing cattle. Both the men died.

On 3 January 2021, friends of a woman killed by her boyfriend marched to his house in Browns Farms in Philippi (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration against the decision of the police to release him. The group marched to the house with the intention to set it on fire but decided not to after pleas from residents of the area.

source: Citizen (South Africa); IOL; Times (South Africa); Sowetan (South Africa); Witness; Daily Sun (South Africa)
notes: On 3 January 2021, KwaJobe residents attacked and killed a suspected robber and injured 5 others, also setting 2 cars on fire in Jozini (uMkhanyakude, KwaZulu-Natal). The mob intercepted the group after seeing the cars parked at night close to a school that had been robbed (along with 3 others). One of the suspects was found with a gun. The 5 injured suspects were handed to the police, while 5 other suspects were intercepted by the police in another car, with several school equipment with them.

source: SABC News; News24 (South Africa); African News Agency
notes: On 2 January 2021, members of the police were attacked with stones and other objects in Greenside Extension 44, on the outskirts of Polokwane (Capricorn, Limpopo) after an illegal migrant was shot and injured. The police were arresting 4 illegal foreign nationals when one allegedly threatened to stab them, for which he was shot and later arrested. One of the other immigrants then called community members, and the attack ensued. The immigrants evaded; 3 police officers were injured, and 3 police cars were damaged. A person was arrested for inciting the attack against the officers.
On 1 January 2021, a group set tires on fire, barricading a road in Zamdela (Fezile Dabi, Free State) in a demonstration regarding the lack of electricity in the area.

On 31 December 2020, residents from the Thembisile Hani, Dr JS Moroka and Elias Motsoaledi municipalities (KwaNdebele) gathered in front of the Union Buildings in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) to demand the construction of the promised Moloto Rail Project, projected to reduce travel time and develop the region.

On 29 December 2020, a man was killed by a mob in the New Town area, Motherwell (Nelson Mandela Bay, Eastern Cape). The group were accusing the man of committing housebreakings in the area. 2 people were arrested.

On 28 December 2020, a man was killed by a mob in the village of Mkhapuza, near Lady Frere/Cacadu (Cacadu, Eastern Cape) after he allegedly stole some clothes from a relative; the victim was running away from rehab for drug addiction.

assoc_actor_1: ANC: African National Congress; Government of South Africa (1994-)
notes: On 28 December 2020, a female police officer was attacked and injured by an ANC councilor and 6 other men in the police station of Waterval (Nkangala, Mpumalanga). The event happened after the officer requested a store to cease the alcohol sale (under the alcohol ban period); the store owner called the ANC member, who went to the police unit with the attack following.

On 26 December 2020, a man was shot and killed, and 3 others were shot and injured by alleged soldiers outside a tavern in Hartebeeskop (Gert Sibande, Mpumalanga). The group arrived in a car, shot at the group, kicked their cars and left.

On 25 December 2020, a man and a teenager were beaten and injured by 5 police officers after their detention in Cookhouse (Cacadu, Eastern Cape). The two were arrested for breaking the national coronavirus curfew.

On 24 December 2020, 2 people were beaten to death, and a third was beaten and injured by a mob in a block of flats in Brandwag, Bloemfontein (Mangaung, Free State). According to the police, they received a call to report a group assaulting a man. It is not clear what the 3 victims were accused of.

assoc_actor_1: Men on Track; Christian Group (South Africa); Women (South Africa)
notes: Around 23 December 2020 (as reported), a group of men from the Men on Track organization took to the streets in Polokwane (Capricorn, Limpopo) in a demonstration against gender-based violence (GBV).

On 21 December 2020, Sinthumule and Kutama residents, members of the farming community and local pastors barricaded the D959 and D3715 roads and blocked the Madombidzha crossing with stones in Makhado/Louis Trichardt (Vhembe, Limpopo) in a demonstration against the lack of basic services delivery. The group handed a memorandum in the Makhado Municipality offices which included demands regarding the water supply, road security and repair.

On 21 December 2020, a group of security guards entered the Emfuleni Local Municipality building in Vanderbijlpark (Sedibeng, Gaunteng) and held workers and customers captive in a demonstration over late wages.

On 20 December 2020, residents and visitors gathered at the Beacon Island traffic circle in Plettenberg Bay (Eden, Western Cape) in a demonstration against the closure of beaches announced by the president as part of coronavirus-related measures.

Around 20 December 2020 (as reported), a person was killed, and another was severely injured with knobkerries, iron rods, and hammers by a mob of farmers and residents of a community in Reivilo, near Taung (Dr Ruth Segomotsi Mompati, North-West) for allegedly stealing 3 cattle. 2 other suspects escaped. The group also allegedly burnt the suspects' vehicle.

On 19 December 2020, a group of small business owners and other people gathered at the construction site of a mall in Ga-Rankuwa (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) to demand the payment of late wages (for the small business owners who are working in the mall construction), and employment (for the area residents). The group also accused the community liaison officer (CLO) of nepotism and corruption.

On 17 December 2020, a group blocked the roads leading to the Department of Labour, Pinetown (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) after being announced that the building would be closed for the third consecutive day for a deep cleanup.

assoc_actor_1: EFF: Economic Freedom Fighters; Labor Group (South Africa)
notes: On 15 December 2020, workers, supported by North West EFF members, marched to a resort in Sun City (Bojanala Platinum, North-West) for a second day in a demonstration against their retrenchment.

On 14 December 2020, hundreds of demonstrators took to the streets and barricaded the D959 and D3715 roads in Makhado/Louis Trichardt (Vhembe, Limpopo) in a demonstration to demand water, sanitation and proper roads.

assoc_actor_1: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions; ANC: African National Congress; Labor Group (South Africa)
notes: On 14 December 2020, COSATU and ANC members marched to a resort in Sun City (Bojanala Platinum, North-West) in a demonstration against workers' retrenchment.

assoc_actor_1: ANCWL: African National Congress Womens League; Women (South Africa)
notes: On 14 December 2020, ANCWL members took to the streets in Acornhoek (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga) in a demonstration against gender-based violence (GBV).

assoc_actor_1: Protesters (eSwatini); Labor Group (eSwatini); Labor Group (South Africa)
notes: On 14 December 2020, close to 100 truck drivers from South Africa and eSwatini blocked the Ngwenya border post (Amathole, Eastern Cape) in a demonstration against procedures regarding coronavirus tests and the limit of trucks crossing the border. Traffic police officers were called, and the drivers dispersed.

On 14 December 2020, Hanover Park residents gathered in front of the Athlone Magistrates Court, Athlone (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) to demand the judiciary not to grand bail to the 2 police officers arrested after killing a man on 5 December (coded separately).
On 14 December 2020, a police officer on his way to work was shot and killed by unidentified individuals in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). Motivation are unknown.

source: Daily Sun (South Africa); News24 (South Africa); Citizen (South Africa); IOL
notes: On 13 December 2020, a man was kidnapped from his home in Emasangweni, set on fire and killed by a group in Melmoth (uThungulu, KwaZulu-Natal). 4 people, including an induna (leader) were arrested. The motivation for the attack was unknown/not reported.

assoc_actor_1: Labor Group (South Africa); R2K: Right 2 Know (South Africa); BlindSA
notes: On 12 December 2020, civil rights groups and artists marched to the Union Buildings in Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) to deliver a memorandum in braille with demands related to better accessibility to blind people in education and against the blocking of fair use rights for artists which curb their opportunity to translate works to braille. The event was organized by Right2Know and BlindSA.
On 12 December 2020, primary school students, friends and family of a girl killed the previous week held placards calling for justice during her funeral in Eersterust (City of Tshwane, Gauteng).

On 11 December 2020, South Durban basin community members marched to a refinery in Tara Road, Wentworth (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to demand all residents and workers affected by an explosion which happened 2 weeks prior to be adequately compensated; at least 7 people were injured in the explosion.
On 11 December 2020, workers for a rental agency gathered in front of the business in Nelspruit/Mbombela (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga) in a demonstration to demand bonuses and wage increases.

On 10 December 2020, a group took to the streets in Rustenburg (Bojanala Platinum, North-West) in a march to hand a memorandum with several demands and complaints, including mining industry and business-related issues, to the municipal offices.

assoc_actor_1: Women (South Africa); ANCWL: African National Congress Womens League
notes: On 10 December 2020, a group supported by the ANC Women's League of the Josiah Gumede Region took to the streets in Estcourt (uThukela, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against gender-based violence (GBV). The group handed a memorandum to the Estcourt police station requesting commitment from the police in cases of GBV.

On 10 December 2020, about 1,000 workers and community members set objects on fire on the R74 road, in the proximities of a religious mission farm, near Maphumulo (iLembe, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against the alleged unfair dismissal of over 20 workers in the past month.

On 10 December 2020, about 40 women gathered in front of the Khayelitsha Magistrates Court (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand better facilities at the sexual offences court. The group handed over a memorandum to Khayelitsha court manager.
On 10 December 2020, a large group of refugee female traders were attacked by locals between Pixley Ka Sema and Pine streets, Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal).

assoc_actor_1: Women (South Africa); Police Forces of South Africa (1994-); Labor Group (South Africa)
notes: On 9 December 2020, a group took to the streets in Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a motorcade against gender-based violence (GBV), drugs and human trafficking. The police and emergency workers participated in the event.

On 9 December 2020, a group gathered in front of the South Gauteng High Court, Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration against a man accused of killing a woman in June who was set to appear in court.

On 9 December 2020, over a dozen Westbank residents took to the streets in Malmesbury (West Coast, Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand an investigation regarding the high utility bills and a change in the electricity supplier. The group handed over a list of demands to the mayor.

assoc_actor_1: SWEAT: Sex Workers Education and Advocacy Taskforce; Asijiki Coalition
notes: On 9 December 2020, about two dozen members of the SWEAT and the Asijiki Coalition gathered in front of a museum in the Company Gardens, Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration over the investigation of the death of a sex worker while in police custody in April 2020. The group called for a meeting with the South African human rights commissioner.
On 9 December 2020, a demonstration was registered on the R103 road, near the Estcourt Hospital (uThukela, KwaZulu-Natal). The motivation for the event was not reported/unknown.

On 9 December 2020, Lenga informal settlement residents marched to Cape Town's councilor's house in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration against the allocation of land to fire victims that the group claim is theirs.

Around 9 December 2020 (as reported), foreign national traders were attacked at the Church Walk flea market, Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal). The group stated that the perpetrators used xenophobic insults against them.

source: News24 (South Africa); Times (South Africa); SABC News
notes: On 9 December 2020, about 200 South Durban basin community members marched to a refinery in Tara Road, Wentworth (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to demand all residents and workers affected by an explosion which happened the week prior to be adequately compensated; at least 7 people were injured in the explosion.

On 8 December 2020, more than 60 young Nomzamo residents marched to the Eskom offices in Soweto (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand electricity in their community. The area has been without electricity since July 2019.

assoc_actor_1: SANCO: South African National Civic Organization; Teachers (South Africa)
source: Times (South Africa); Daily Dispatch; Sowetan (South Africa)
notes: On 8 December 2020, private school teachers, supported by SANCO members, gathered in front of the Gauteng Education Department in Johannesburg (City of Johannesburg, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand the payment of late wages and subsidies.
On 7 December 2020, a man was beaten and injured by a mob in the Thulamahashi Plaza (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga) after an attempted robbery. He was rescued by the police.
Around 7 December 2020 (as reported), a man was killed and another was injured by a mob in Rooiboklaagte (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga) after a robbery.

assoc_actor_1: Women (South Africa); COPE: Congress of the People
notes: On 7 December 2020, a group, led by COPE, gathered in front of the Soshanguve Magistrate's Court (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to request that the court to be used exclusively for cases of gender-based violence (GBV) and child abuse.
On 7 December 2020, a group destroyed property at a university in Vanderbijlpark (Sedibeng, Gauteng) during a demonstration. The motivation for the event was not reported/unknown.

On 6 December 2020, hundreds of people gathered in front of the main gate of a refinery in Tara Road, Wentworth (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration to demand the closure of the plant. The demonstration was prompted by an explosion in the plant, which injured at least 7 people.

On 5 December 2020, hundreds of supporters of the independence of the Western Cape province took to streets in Stellenbosch (Cape Winelands, Western Cape) to deliver a memorandum demanding the local government to recognize their right to a referendum on independence.

On 5 December 2020, a man was killed by 5 people in the Vergenoeg farm, near Delareyville (Ngaka Modiri Molema, North-West) for allegedly being on the farm to steal. The 5 were arrested but released on bail.

On 5 December 2020, an off-duty armed response officer was shot and killed by police officers in Hanover Park (City of Cape Town, Western Cape). The man was in a playground with his children when the officer arrived and ordered them to lay down, shooting the man. The police also use pepper spray to prevent one of his daughters from gathering the bullet's shell. The motivation for the event is unknown.

assoc_actor_1: Women (South Africa); Police Forces of South Africa (1994-)
notes: Around 5 December 2020 (weekend of), a group of residents, together with members of the police, held a motorcade at the Chatsworth Stadium, Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) against gender-based violence (GBV).

On 5 December 2020, members of the Right2Know group gathered in front of the offices of a broadcast company in Durban (eThekwini, KwaZulu-Natal) in a demonstration against the company's retrenchment and restructuring process, which, they claim, undermines the public's right to information.
On 4 December 2020, a group gathered in front of the Mkhuhlu Magistrates Court (Ehlanzeni, Mpumalanga) to oppose the granting of bail for a woman accused of stabbing a man to death.

assoc_actor_1: Women (South Africa); WoSA: Women of South Africa
notes: On 4 December 2020, a group of women, especially from rural areas, marched to the North West Development Centre in or near Mahikeng (Ngaka Modiri Molema, North West) in a demonstration to demand more participation in the economy. Demonstrations were held in the financial areas of several cities and organized by WoSA.

assoc_actor_1: Women (South Africa); WoSA: Women of South Africa; COSAS: Congress of South African Students; Students (South Africa)
notes: On 4 December 2020, over 100 women and COSAS members took to the streets in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration to demand more participation in the economy and the end of gender-base violence (GBV). Demonstrations were held in the financial areas of several cities and organized by WoSA.

assoc_actor_1: Women (South Africa); WoSA: Women of South Africa; ANCWL: African National Congress Womens League
notes: On 4 December 2020, members of the WoSA and the women's league of the ANC marched to the Union Buildings, Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) in a demonstration to demand better policies towards gender-based violence (GBV) and more participation of women in the economy.

assoc_actor_1: COSATU: Congress of South African Trade Unions; SADTU: South African Democratic Teachers Union; POPCRU: Police and Prisons Civil Rights Union (South Africa); NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union; Labor Group (South Africa); DENOSA: Democratic Nursing Organisation of South Africa; Health Workers (South Africa); Teachers (South Africa)
notes: On 4 December 2020, members of the COSATU, SADTU, POPCRU, NEHAWU and DENOSA gathered in front of the Union Buildings, Pretoria (City of Tshwane, Gauteng) to demand answers regarding a memorandum with demands delivered to the president in October regarding issues around the retrenchment of workers and the preservation of jobs.

On 4 December 2020, youth from Moretele marched to the old Moretele College, Makapanstad (Bojanala Platinum, North-west) in a demonstration to demand the school to be open and the construction of a tertiary school in the area.

assoc_actor_1: NUMSA: National Union of Metalworkers of South Africa; Labor Group (South Africa)

On 2 December 2020, about 70 parents, teachers, students, and community members gathered in front of a high school in Heathfield (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) for a vigil in support of the school's principal who is facing a disciplinary hearing after he refused to open the school in July due to the coronavirus.

The event is believed to be linked to the ongoing truck drivers events being registered in several parts of the country, with several trucks being set on fire in suspected xenophobic attacks.

On 1 December 2020, residents of an informal settlement set 3 trucks on fire in the proximities of the Jerusalema community, near Boksburg (Ekurhuleni, Gauteng) during a demonstration to demand electricity in the community. The group also demonstrated the next day (coded separately).

On 1 December 2020, Redan community residents gathered in front of the Magistrate Court in Vereeniging (Sedibeng, Gauteng) in a demonstration against a man who shot and killed another resident in August.

assoc_actor_1: Women (South Africa); Farmers (South Africa); Fishers (South Africa)

On 30 November 2020, a small group of people gathered outside the Cape Town Magistrate's Court (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration over court delays in cases involving physical assault, abuse and gender-based violence (GBV).

On 30 November 2020, a large crowd, of mostly women, gathered in front the Elliotdale magistrate's court (Amathole, Eastern Cape) in a demonstration against a man accused of killing 6 family members with an axe.

On 28 November 2020, about 150 people gathered in front of the Parliament in Cape Town (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) in a demonstration against gender-based violence (GBV). The demonstration is part of the '16 Days of Activism for No Violence Against Women and Children'.

assoc_actor_1: Students (South Africa); Women (South Africa); Farmers (South Africa)

Ongoing demonstrations are being reported regarding demands of miners concerning local recruitment, skills development and social investment initiatives, among others.
